questions.question: Is there an error in this sentence excerpt? If so, where? "An article by Forbes states that “adequate and equitable...."

choices.answer: Forbes should be put in quotes

questions.question: "the decision to become a social studies teacher is plain and simple, knowledge...."
Which of the following questions uses punctuation correctly?

choices.answer: “What kind of job do you plan on getting?”.
“What kind of job do you plan on getting?
“What kind of job do you plan on getting?”
“What kind of job do you plan on getting.”

questions.question: Which of the following excerpts is written correctly?

choices.answer: In Scott Jaschik’s article, "Making the Case for Liberal Arts Colleges," he
In Scott Jaschik’s article, Making the Case for Liberal Arts Colleges, he
In Scott Jaschik’s article, Making the Case for Liberal Arts Colleges, he
In Scott Jaschik’s article, Making the Case for Liberal Arts Colleges he

questions.question: Historians primarily use _______ for issues of style.
When a student paraphrases from a primary or secondary source, it is not necessary to cite the source.
If writing a paper or answering a question, students can copy text verbatim from their textbook without citing it.
What grade will a student receive if he/she is discovered to have plagiarized on an assignment in Dr. Kincaid's class?

choices.answer: no grade, but a chance to resubmit the paper

questions.question: Students should block quote all passages that are more than _________ lines long.
Students should use the author-date system whenever they write a paper in history.
